'''Jason Bradley DeFord''' (born December 4, 1984), known professionally as '''Jelly Roll''' (originally stylized as '''JellyRoll'''), is an American singer, rapper, and songwriter from [[Antioch, Tennessee]]. Beginning his career in 2003, he rose to mainstream prominence following the release of his 2022 [[Single (music)|single]]s "[[Son of a Sinner]]" and "[[Need a Favor]]".

"Son of a Sinner" won three [[2023 CMT Music Awards|CMT Music Awards]] in 2023.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Hall |first1=Kristin |title='Son of a Sinner' Jelly Roll reigns at CMT Music Awards show |url=https://apnews.com/article/2023-cmt-music-awards-6a615e55ab1d093c7a47ef55696f3d81 |website=APNews |access-date=2 June 2023 |date=3 April 2023}}</ref> That same year, he won for [[Country Music Association Award for New Artist of the Year|New Artist]] at the [[57th Annual Country Music Association Awards|CMA Awards]], and was nominated for [[Best New Artist]] at the [[66th Annual Grammy Awards]].

==Early life==
DeFord was raised in the [[Antioch, Tennessee|Antioch]] neighborhood of [[Nashville, Tennessee]].<ref name="Gawker">{{Cite web |last=Dodero |first=Camille |date=June 14, 2013 |title=The Story of the 450-Pound Rapper Who Loved Waffle House Too Much |url=https://www.gawkerarchives.com/the-story-of-the-450-pound-rapper-who-loved-waffle-hous-5992463 |website=Gawker}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=Dowling |first1=Marcus K. |title=Jelly Roll on his three 2023 CMT Music Award noms: 'A nomination calls for a celebration' |url=https://www.tennessean.com/story/entertainment/music/2023/03/09/jelly-roll-on-his-three-2023-cmt-video-award-noms/69991256007/ |access-date=April 9, 2023 |publisher=The Tennessean |date=March 9, 2023 |quote=I'm just a kid from Antioch, Tennessee}}</ref> His father was a meat salesman and worked as a [[bookmaker|bookie]] on the side; his mother suffered from [[Mental disorder|mental illness]] and [[addiction]].<ref name="The New York Times 2023"/>

From his teenage years into his 20s, Jelly Roll was arrested several times and spent time in jail for various charges/[[felony|felonies]] including possession with intent to distribute and aggravated [[robbery]].<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Nicholson |first=Jessica |date=2021-09-16 |title=Nashville Native Jelly Roll on Shifting From Hip Hop to Country-Rock: 'I Want to Change The Way Music Is Done on Those Streets' |url=https://www.billboard.com/music/country/jelly-roll-interview-nashville-ryman-9631132/ |access-date=2023-07-05 |magazine=Billboard |language=en-US}}</ref><ref name="The New York Times 2023"/>  While imprisoned, he earned his [[GED]] at the age of 23.<ref name="The New York Times 2023">{{cite web | title=Meet Jelly Roll, the Rapper Turned Country Singer Rousing Nashville | website=The New York Times | date=2023-04-26 | url=https://www.nytimes.com/2023/04/26/arts/music/jelly-roll-whitsitt-chapel.html | access-date=2023-08-08}}</ref>

==Career==
Jelly Roll launched his career in hip hop after being inspired by rappers such as [[Three 6 Mafia]], [[UGK]], and [[8Ball & MJG]]. He sold [[mixtapes]] out of his car,<ref name="The New York Times 2023"/> starting with a string of releases from his first project ''The Plain Shmear Tape'' in 2003 then following with the four part ''Gamblin' on the White Boy'' series from 2004 to 2011. His 2010 collaboration "Pop Another Pill" with [[Memphis, Tennessee|Memphis]] rapper [[Lil Wyte]] reached over 6.3 million [[YouTube]] views.<ref>{{Cite web |date=March 19, 2010 |title=JellyRoll Feat. Lil Wyte POP ANOTHER PILL – YouTube |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vJC62rvx6X4 |access-date=October 26, 2020 |website=[[YouTube]]}}</ref> This song led to the album ''Year Round'' by the hip-hop group SNO, of which Jelly Roll was a member. Over the next few years, Jelly Roll released many mixtapes and independent solo albums including collaborations with Lil Wyte, [[Struggle Jennings]], [[Haystak]], and [[Tech N9ne]].<ref>{{cite web |last1=Will |first1=Ill |title=Jelly Roll On The Importance Of Tech N9ne: 'His Energy Is So Pure' |url=https://hiphopdx.com/news/jelly-roll-importance-of-tech-n9ne |website=HipHopDX |access-date=2 June 2023 |date=17 January 2023}}</ref> Jelly Roll's 2013 mixtape ''Whiskey, Weed, & Women'' was originally named ''Whiskey, Weed, & Waffle House'',<ref name=Gawker /> but was later changed after [[Waffle House]] threatened legal action over the use of their name and logo on the cover. The replacement cover featured a "[[cease and desist]]" stamp in place of the restaurant's logo.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Paine |first=Jake |date=April 5, 2013 |title=JellyRoll Responds To Waffle House Cease & Desist, New Mixtape Artwork & Title |url=https://hiphopdx.com/news/id.23454/title.jellyroll-responds-to-waffle-house-cease-desist-new-mixtape-artwork-title |access-date=April 16, 2019 |website=[[HipHopDX]]}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Tishgart |first=Sierra |date=June 14, 2013 |title=Waffle House Screwed Over Its Biggest Fan, a Rapper Named Jelly Roll |url=http://www.grubstreet.com/2013/06/waffle-house-jelly-roll.html |access-date=April 16, 2019 |website=Grub Street |publisher=[[New York (magazine)|New York Magazine]] |language=en}}</ref>

Jelly Roll made his [[Grand Ole Opry]] debut on November 9, 2021.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Decker |first1=David |title=Jelly Roll Blows the Roof off the Fillmore Auditorium |url=https://digitalbeatmag.com/jelly-roll-blows-the-roof-off-the-fillmore-auditorium/ |website=Digital Beat Magazine |access-date=14 April 2023 |date=15 October 2021}}</ref> On July 7, 2022, he was invited by fellow country singer [[Craig Morgan]] to join him on stage at the Opry to perform "[[Almost Home (Craig Morgan song)|Almost Home]]".<ref>{{cite web |last1=Seller |first1=Christine |title=Craig Morgan Brings Jelly Roll To Tears With Heartfelt Gift At The Opry: "This Is A True Testimony That God Is Real" |url=https://musicmayhemmagazine.com/craig-morgan-brings-jelly-roll-to-tears-with-heartfelt-gift-at-the-opry-this-is-a-true-testimony-that-god-is-real/ |website=Music Mayhem |access-date=14 April 2023 |date=7 July 2022}}</ref> On May 9, 2022, Jelly Roll scored his first number one on rock radio with the track "Dead Man Walking".<ref>{{cite web |last1=Wendowski |first1=Andrew |title=Jelly Roll Scores First-Ever No. 1 Radio Hit With "Dead Man Walking": "The Losers Win Again Baby!" |url=https://musicmayhemmagazine.com/jelly-roll-scores-first-ever-no-1-radio-hit-with-dead-man-walking-the-losers-win-again-baby/ |website=Music Mayhem |access-date=14 April 2023 |date=9 May 2022}}</ref> In January 2023, Jelly Roll scored his first number-one song on Country radio with his debut country single "[[Son of a Sinner]]", written by himself, [[Ernest (singer)|Ernest]], and David Ray Stevens. The track was the second single from the 2021 album ''[[Ballads of the Broken]]'' and also peaked at number 8 on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' Hot Rock & Alternative Songs chart.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Holthouse |first1=Jerry |title=Jelly Roll Scores His First Number One |url=https://www.nashville.com/jelly-roll-scores-his-first-number-one/ |website=Nashville.com |access-date=14 April 2023 |date=9 January 2023}}</ref> In February 2023, he made history with a record-breaking 25th week at number 1 on ''Billboard'''s Emerging Artists chart.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Zellner |first1=Xander |title=Jelly Roll Breaks Record for Most Weeks Spent at No. 1 on Emerging Artists Chart |url=https://www.billboard.com/music/chart-beat/jelly-roll-record-most-weeks-atop-emerging-artists-chart-1235250392/ |website=Billboard |access-date=14 April 2023 |date=8 February 2023}}</ref> Jelly Roll sold out Nashville's [[Bridgestone Arena]] on December 9, 2022, to 15,000 fans and was joined by [[Chris Young (singer)|Chris Young]], [[Sam Hunt]], [[Riley Green]], [[Shinedown]], Ernest, Struggle Jennings, Tech N9ne, and [[Krizz Kaliko]].<ref>{{cite web |last1=Watts |first1=Cindy |title=Pics: Jelly Roll Sells Out Nashville's Bridgestone Arena with Chris Young, Sam Hunt, Struggle Jennings and more|url=https://www.cmt.com/news/8xxn85/pics-jelly-roll-sells-out-nashvilles-bridgestone-arena-with-chris-young-sam-hunt-struggle-jennings-and-more |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221218181057/https://www.cmt.com/news/8xxn85/pics-jelly-roll-sells-out-nashvilles-bridgestone-arena-with-chris-young-sam-hunt-struggle-jennings-and-more |url-status=dead |archive-date=December 18, 2022 |website=[[CMT (American TV channel)|CMT]] |access-date=14 April 2023 |date=12 December 2022}}</ref> In the summer of 2023, he completed a 44-city 'Backroad Baptism Tour'.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Liptak |first1=Carena |title=Jelly Roll unleashes plans for Backroad Baptism Arena Tour |url=https://tasteofcountry.com/jelly-roll-2023-north-american-backroad-baptism-tour/ |website=Taste of Country |access-date=14 April 2023 |date=20 February 2023}}</ref> At the [[2023 CMT Music Awards]], Jelly Roll won for Male Video of the Year, Male Breakthrough Video of the Year, and Digital-First Performance of the Year, all for the song "Son of a Sinner".<ref>{{cite magazine |last1=Lipshutz |first1=Jason |last2=Unterberger |first2=Andrew |title=Jelly Roll Keeps Winning After CMT Music Awards With Big 'Son of a Sinner' and 'Need a Favor' Gains |url=https://www.billboard.com/pro/jelly-roll-cmt-music-awards-son-of-a-sinner-need-a-favor-trending-up/ |magazine=Billboard |access-date=April 9, 2023 |date=April 5, 2023}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last1=France |first1=Lisa Respers |title=Jelly Roll reigns among first-time winners at the CMT Music Awards |url=https://www.cnn.com/2023/04/03/entertainment/jelly-roll-cmt-awards/index.html |website=CNN |access-date=April 9, 2023 |date=April 3, 2023}}</ref>

Jelly Roll released his album ''[[Whitsitt Chapel]]'' featuring the single "[[Need a Favor]]" on June 2, 2023.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Patton |first1=Alli |title=Jelly Roll Confirms Highly Anticipated New Album "Whitsitt Chapel" |url=https://americansongwriter.com/jelly-roll-confirms-highly-anticipated-new-album-whitsitt-chapel/ |website=American Songwriter |access-date=14 April 2023 |date=18 March 2023}}</ref> In November 2023, Jelly Roll won the award for [[Country Music Association Award for New Artist of the Year|New Artist of the Year]] at the [[57th Annual Country Music Association Awards]]. In January 2024, Jelly Roll testified before the U.S. Congress, in support of anti-[[fentanyl]] legislation.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Jason "Jelly Roll" DeFord Opening Statement|url=https://www.c-span.org/video/?c5101566/jason-jelly-roll-deford-opening-statement |access-date=2024-01-15 |website=C-SPAN}}</ref> Explaining his perspective as a former distributor of illegal drugs, Jelly Roll stated before the [[United States Senate Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs|U.S. Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs Committee]]  “I was a part of the problem. I am here now, standing as a man that wants to be a part of the solution".<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://thehill.com/homenews/senate/4402984-jelly-roll-testifies-congress-fentanyl-legislation/|title=Jelly Roll urges Congress to pass anti-fentanyl legislation|first=Julia|last=Shapero|date=January 11, 2024}}</ref>

In April 2024, Jelly Roll was sued by Pennsylvania-based wedding band Jellyroll for trademark infringement.<ref>
{{Cite web|url=https://whyy.org/articles/jellyroll-jelly-roll-lawsuit-trademark-infringement/#:~:text=A%20Pennsylvania%20wedding%20band%20is,Black%20Tie%20Tailgate%2C%20for%20years|title=Pa. wedding band Jellyroll suing country star Jelly Roll, claiming trademark infringement|website=WHYY |date=April 17, 2024}}</ref> The case was later settled out of court.<ref>[https://www.nbcphiladelphia.com/news/business/wedding-band-jellyroll-name-lawsuit-jelly-roll/3906992/ Pa.-based wedding band Jellyroll settles lawsuit with country star Jelly Roll over name, attorney says] NBC10 Philadelphia. July 10, 2024.</ref> In July 2024, Jelly Roll was featured on [[Eminem]]'s twelfth album ''[[The Death of Slim Shady (Coup de Grâce)]]'' on the track "[[Somebody Save Me (Eminem song)|Somebody Save Me]]", which sampled his song "[[Save Me (Jelly Roll song)|Save Me]]". He appeared in its music video released the following month.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.hotnewhiphop.com/835814-eminem-jelly-roll-somebody-save-me-music-video-hip-hop-news|title=Eminem & Jelly Roll Drop Tear-Jerking Music Video For "Somebody Save Me"|website=[[HotNewHipHop]]|last=Horvath|first=Zachary|date=August 21, 2024|access-date=August 23, 2024}}</ref> On July 8, Jelly Roll made his first international appearance at the [[Meridian Centre]] in [[St. Catharines]], Ontario, Canada.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Savoie |first1=Dan |title=Breaking Borders: Jelly Roll’s Epic Canadian Debut Rocks Niagara |url=https://519magazine.com/breaking-borders-jelly-rolls-epic-canadian-debut-rocks-niagara/ |website=519 Magazine |access-date=3 September 2024}}</ref> On August 23, 2024, Jelly Roll announced his upcoming album ''Beautifully Broken''. It is scheduled to be released on October 11, 2024.<ref>{{cite web|url= https://www.billboard.com/music/country/jelly-roll-new-album-beautifully-broken-release-date-1235759941|title=Jelly Roll Announces New Album: Here's When 'Beautifully Broken' Arrives|last=Chan|first=Anna|magazine=Billboard|date=August 23, 2024|access-date=August 23, 2024}}</ref>

Jelly Roll made his television debut on the television drama series ''[[Tulsa King]]'' with [[Sylvester Stallone]]. The episode was released in September 2024 and featured Jelly Roll performing a rendition of "[[I Am Not Okay]]".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/entertainment/tv/2024/09/20/jelly-roll-tulsa-king-appearance/75295227007/|title=Jelly Roll makes 'Tulsa King' TV debut with Sylvester Stallone's mobster: Watch them meet|last=Alexander|first=Bryan|date=September 20, 2024|accessdate=September 22, 2024|work=[[USA Today]]}}</ref>

On September 28, 2024, Jelly Roll was the first musical guest of the [[Saturday Night Live season 50|50th season]] of [[Saturday Night Live]] performing "Liar" and "Winning Streak."<ref>{{Cite AV media |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=shared&v=5A8VulFUX4g |title=Jelly Roll: Liar (Live) - SNL |date=2024-09-28 |last=Saturday Night Live |access-date=2024-09-29 |via=YouTube}}</ref><ref>{{Cite AV media |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=share&v=aqUiVcYVmUo |title=Jelly Roll: Winning Streak (Live) - SNL |date=2024-09-28 |last=Saturday Night Live |access-date=2024-09-29 |via=YouTube}}</ref>

==Personal life==
Jelly Roll has been married to his wife Alyssa DeFord, known as "Bunnie XO", since 2016. The couple renewed their wedding vows in 2023. He has two children: daughter Bailee (b. 2008) from a previous relationship, whom he and Bunnie have full custody of, and son Noah (b. 2016) from another previous relationship.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Peake |first1=Amber |title=Who is Jelly Roll's wife, Bunnie? Rapper shares sweet family snap |url=https://www.thefocus.news/music/jelly-roll-wife/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230820145357/https://www.hitc.com/en-gb/2021/05/28/jelly-roll-wife/ |archive-date=2023-08-20 |url-status=dead |website=The Focus |access-date=February 8, 2022 |date=May 28, 2021}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Jelly Roll Opens Up About the Day He Found Out He Was a Dad — While Sitting in Prison (Exclusive) |url=https://people.com/jelly-roll-day-he-found-out-daughter-birth-in-prison-exclusive-8416851 |access-date=2024-03-08 |website=Peoplemag |language=en}}</ref>

==Discography==
{{main|Jelly Roll discography}}
'''Studio albums'''
* ''The Big Sal Story'' (2012)
* ''Sobriety Sucks'' (2016)
* ''Addiction Kills'' (2017)
* ''Goodnight Nashville'' (2018)
* ''Whiskey Sessions II'' (2019)
* ''[[A Beautiful Disaster]]'' (2020)
* ''Self Medicated'' (2020)
* ''[[Ballads of the Broken]]'' (2021)
* ''[[Whitsitt Chapel]]'' (2023)
* ''Beautifully Broken'' (2024)

'''Collaborative albums'''
* ''Year Round'' (with [[Lil Wyte]] and BPZ) (2011)
* ''[[Strictly Business (Haystak & Jelly Roll album)|Strictly Business]]'' (with [[Haystak]]) (2011)
* ''[[No Filter (Lil Wyte and JellyRoll album)|No Filter]]'' (with Lil Wyte) (2013)
* ''[[Business as Usual (Haystak & Jelly Roll album)|Business as Usual]]'' (with Haystak) (2013)
* ''[[No Filter 2]]'' (with Lil Wyte) (2016)
* ''Waylon & Willie'' (with [[Struggle Jennings]]) (2017)
* ''Waylon & Willie II'' (with Struggle Jennings) (2018)
* ''Waylon & Willie III'' (with Struggle Jennings) (2018)
* ''Waylon & Willie IV'' (with Struggle Jennings) (2020)
